III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/21/23, youth was restrained by staff members due to
escalated behavior. Youth was assaulting staff and there are
concerns that one staff member bit youth during the restraint.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face on 5/25/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported he was
restrained by Staff 1 as he was throwing rocks at him. Youth A
did not remember how Staff 1 restrained him or the restraint
position. Youth A reported Staff 1 was holding his arms and Staff
2, Staff 3, and Supervisor were there. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3
were all holding Youth A. Youth A did not remember how staff
were holding him. Youth A reported Staff 1 bite him on the right
hand in the meaty part under his pinky finger. Youth A reported
he received a cut under his right eye, a scratch on his nose, and a
scrap on his right shoulder from the incident. Youth A did not
remember what occurred during the restraint that resulted in the
injuries. Nurse viewed the injuries. Youth A reported Staff 1 bite
him on the right hand at the beginning of the restraint and then
changed and reported it happened at the end of the restraint.
Youth A did not remember any other youth witnessing the
incident. Youth A did not remember what Staff 2 and Supervisor
were doing during the restraint. Youth A reported he went back
inside the house after the restraint.
Youth B was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 5/31/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported he did not
see the restraint Youth A was placed in by Staff 1. Youth B was
inside the house with all the other youth and Staff 3. Youth B
reported he did see a bite mark on Youth A’s upper wrist area
which Youth A told him was from Staff 1 biting him. Youth B
reported Youth A also had a bruise however he did not recall
where. Youth B only remembered Staff 1 being outside with
Youth A. Youth B did not have any other concerns.
2

Nurse was interviewed face-to-face on 5/25/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Nurse went to the school to
see Youth A as Youth A refused to come up to the office to be
seen after the restraint. Nurse documented the scrap on Youth
A’s shoulder and mark on Youth A’s right hand. Nurse reported
Youth A did not say much to him. Nurse did not see teeth marks
on Youth A’s right hand however stated it could have been a bite.
Youth A did not need any additional medical follow up. Nurse
reported Youth A's shoulder scrap looked more as if he had been
poked by something. Nurse reported Youth A tends to always
have a lot of scratches and bruises as he likes to be out in the
woods a lot.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face on 5/25/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 was working in
another house and responded to an assistance call. Staff 1
arrived to Putnam house and heard a window breaking. Youth A
had used a rock to break the window on the side door of the
house. Staff 1 saw Youth A and the rock falling and Youth A
standing in broken glass. Staff 1 tried to get Youth A to move
away from the broken glass. Staff 1 was trying to talk to Youth A
when Youth A began swinging trying to punch Staff 1. Staff 1
initiated a standing benevolent restraint and transitioned to a
seated safety position restraint due to Youth A scratching Staff 1’s
eyes and nose causing Staff 1 to have a bloody nose while in the
standing benevolent restraint. Staff 1 reported during this time
Youth A put his hand in Staff 1’s mouth while scratching causing
Staff 1 to get cuts on his lips and gums. Staff 1 reported he did
not bite Youth A. While in the seated safety position, Youth A was
scratching Staff 1’s face and back of his neck. Youth A then bite
Staff 1’s arm. Staff 1 reported Youth A was moving a lot in the
restraint and shifted his weight resulting in Youth A going into a
prone position. Staff 1 reported he immediately disengaged from
the restraint due to Youth A flipping over to his belly. Youth A was
still trying to hit and bite Staff 1 once the restraint was released.
Youth A was able to bite Staff 1’s arm again and would not
release the bite. Staff 1 was positioned next to Youth A at this
time. Supervisor arrived and was able to get Youth A to release
the bite. Staff 1 immediately left once his arm was release from
the bite. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was with the other youth when
the restraint occurred. Staff 1 has previously restrained Youth A
and reported Youth A is difficult to restrain due to Youth A moving
a lot in restraints. Youth A has previously bit Staff 1. Staff 1
reported he did not bite Youth A at any time. Staff 1 reported
Youth A had a scratch near his eye prior to the restraint. Staff 1
reported he did not cause any of the injuries on Youth A. Staff 1
3

reported he believed the scraps and scratches were due to Youth
A wiggling around on the ground during the restraint as they were
on sticks and rocks. Staff 1 was observed to have a bite mark on
his right arm and one on his left arm which both broke the skin as
they were now scabbed over. Staff 1 had a scratch near his eye
and scratch marks on both sides on the back of his neck.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face on 5/25/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 was working at
Putnam with Staff 3. Youth A got upset with a peer and began
throwing rocks at his peers. Staff 3 took the other youth inside the
house and Staff 2 remained outside with Youth A. Youth A began
throwing rocks at the house windows. Additional staff were called
to assist with Youth A. Youth A was asked to stop throwing rocks
by Staff 2. Youth A turned towards Staff 2 as he was going to
throw a rock at Staff 2. Staff 2 backed away. Youth A then began
hitting Staff 2 in the head. Staff 2 attempted to place Youth A in a
restraint however Youth A fell to the ground. Staff 2 reported
Youth A is “very wiggly”. Youth A then grabbed a large stick, ran
at Staff 2 with the large stick and then threw it at Staff 2. Youth A
then began throwing rocks at Staff 2. Staff 2 reported he went into
the house to wait for assistance. Staff 2 heard a loud crashing
noise, and he went outside to see Staff 1 having Youth A in a
seated safety position restraint. The crashing sound was from a
large rock Youth A threw through the door window. Youth A was
scratching Staff 1 while in the restraint. Staff 2 was able to secure
ahold of Youth A’s hands to stop him from scratching. Staff 1
released Youth A from the restraint and Youth A grabbed rocks
and began throwing them. Staff 2 left the area. Supervisor
arrived and Staff 2 went back to where Youth A was. Youth A and
Staff 1 were on the ground, Youth A was on his back and Staff 1
was off to the side of Youth A. Youth A was biting Staff 1’s arm.
Once Youth A released from biting Staff 1, Staff 1 got up and left.
Staff 2 reported he did not see Staff 1 bite Youth A at any time or
do anything that would cause the scraps/cuts on Youth A. Once
Youth A got up he grabbed a large chunk of cement and
attempted to throw it at Staff 3. Staff 2 and Staff 3 went into the
house and Supervisor stayed with Youth A. Youth A did not report
he was bit by Staff 1 to Staff 2.
Staff 3 was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 5/31/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 was working with
Staff 2 when Youth A was restrained. Staff 3 reported he did not
see the restraint that was performed by Staff 1 as he had taken all
the other youth into the house due to Youth A being escalated.
Staff 3 had all the youth in the house. Staff 3 did look out the
4

window a few times and did not see anything that was concerning.
Staff 3 reported he believed Youth A’s injuries occurred while he
was in the restraint as Youth A flails his body around a lot during
restraints. Staff 3 reported Youth A spends most of his time
outside and some of the injuries may have been from Youth A’s
normal play. Youth A has been escalating more over the last
month. Youth A did not discuss anything about the restraint with
Staff 3. Staff 3 did go outside after the restraint and Staff 1 had
left to see if he was needed to assist Staff 2 and Supervisor.
Youth A threw a cinderblock at him. Staff 3 was able to move and
not get hit. Staff 3 and Staff 2 went inside the house and
Supervisor remained with Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face on 5/25/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Supervisor responded to
the house as there was a call for additional staff. Supervisor
pulled into the house and saw someone in the back of the house
and when she got to the back, Youth A and Staff 1 were on the
ground and Youth A was moving around a lot “like a wild dog”.
Supervisor moved in to help Staff 1 when Staff 1 stated Youth A
was biting him. Youth A was on the ground on his back facing up
with Staff 1’s arm in his mouth, biting Staff 1. Staff 1 was in a
kneeling position next to Youth A and was leaning over top Youth
A. Supervisor secured Youth A’s arm as Youth A was punching
Staff 1. Youth A released from biting Staff 1. Staff 1 got up and
left. Supervisor reported she did not see Staff 1 bite Youth A
during the incident. Youth A got up and grabbed a large piece of
concrete and threw it at Staff 3. Supervisor told Staff 2 and Staff 3
to go inside as she has a good rapport with Youth A and would
deescalate. Supervisor did not see Staff 2 or Staff 3 involved in a
restraint with Youth A during this incident. Youth A did not tell her
that Staff 1 bite him. Supervisor did see a cut on Youth A’s eye
and scrap on his cheek however did not know where the injuries
came from. Supervisor reported Youth A is very difficult to restrain
as he moves a lot and is able to get out of restraints.
Therapist/ Complainant was interviewed face-to-face on
5/25/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Therapist
reported Youth A told her that Staff 1 bit him on the hand. Youth
A would not talk to Therapist about the other injuries that he had.
Therapist reported Youth A does not typically point fingers at staff.
Therapist reported she could not make sense of Youth A’s injuries
and how he got them. Therapist reported no other concerns.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face on 5/25/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Administrator reported there
5

was no video of the incident as it occurred outside of the house.
Administrator did ask Staff 1 if he had bit Youth A and Staff 1
reported he did not. Administrator reported Youth A is very
difficult to restrain as he moves a lot and is able to get out of
restraints.
MDHHS worker did not have any findings in this
investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village incident report dated 5/21/2023 was
consistent with staff interviews.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 154980204 dated 5/21/2023 was consistent
with staff interviews.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Therapeutic Holds: Prone or supine restraints or
other restraints that may constrict a youth’s breathing are
strictly prohibited.
• Eagle Village Health Care Visit Report for Youth A dated
5/22/2023: Youth A had scratches to his right cheek with
mild swelling, circular bruise on his right-side midclavicular
line about the size of a half dollar, swelling to his right medial
hand from a bit wound, the skin appeared to be intact, both
legs have multiple scrapes and bruises in varying stages of
healing.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Aegis training on
10/20/2022.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as it is unclear what the mark
on Youth A’s hand was from. Staff 1 denied biting Youth A.
Youth A reported he was bite by Staff 1 and initially reported it
was at the beginning of the restraint and then stated it was at the
end of the restraint. There were no witnesses that saw Staff 1 bite
Youth A. The mark on Youth A’s hand was not conclusive to be a
bite mark.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
